Papallacta.main: Descubre uno de los miradores naturales, donde podrás disfrutar de una vista a la ciudad a 4000m, en elTeleférico, luego nos vamos a uno de los iconos de Ecuador, la famosa Mitad del Mundo, Museo delIntiñan y ciudad mitad del mundo, que mejor luego visitar las termas de Papallacta conocidas por altogrado medicinal y de relajación.

ITINERARIO
Recogemos Tribuna de los Shirys 8:00 a.m
Plaza Foch 8:15 a.m
Plaza San Blas 8:30 a.m.
Llegada al Teleférico, Gongola hasta Cruz Loma, 3947msnm.Caminata 45min Columpio.
Retorno al Parqueadero.
Viaje a la Mitad del Mundo
Almuerzo.
Visita IntiñanVisita
Ciudad Mitad del Mundo.
Retorno a Quito. (Dejar y recoger turistas).
Salida a PapallactaTermas 3 horas.
Retorno a Quito.

ITINERARY: Departure from La Mariscal 7:15 AM (Reina Victoria and Foch streets corner)
Visit to the San Pablo Lake viewpoint

ITINERARY.1: Departure from la Mariscal 7:15 am (Juan Leon Mera and Foch streets corner) / SAN BLAS SQUARE 7:30 am.
ITINERARY.6: Walking to the Quilotoa crater and return.

NECESSARY EQUIPMENT.1: COMFORTABLE AND WARM CLOTHES, WINDYPROOF JACKET (OPTIONAL), GLOVES, NECK AND EAR PROTECTION.
NECESSARY EQUIPMENT.4: COMFORTABLE SHOES FOR WALKING IN MOUNTAINOUS AND SANDY TERRAIN.

ITINERARY.1: Departure from Mariscal 7:15 AM (Reina Victoria and Foch Streets corner, PLAZA FOCH Sector) / SAN BLAS SQUARE 7:00 AM

Day1.Activity: Public or private bus to Puente Cuyabeno. Canoe trip down the Cuyabeno River to Dolphin Lodge. Visit Laguna Grande, swim and enjoy sunset. Dinner. Night walk.

Day2.Activity: Three-hour hike in the primary forest to learn about flora and fauna, visit Lagoons to enjoy flooded forest, swim and enjoy sunset. If possible, see pink dolphins. Return to lodge. Dinner.

Day3.Activity: Visit Siona Tarabeaya community, help prepare typical food Casabe, visit shaman who explains about jungle ceremonies. Return to lodge. Dinner. Night canoe expedition in search of caimans.

Day4.Activity: Relaxing morning paddle in traditional canoe on rivers, searching for monkeys and birds. Visit Laguna Grande, swim and enjoy sunset. Dinner. Night canoe expedition in search of caimans.

Day5.Activity: Early morning bird watching. Navigating the Cuyabeno River back to El Puente. Box Lunch. Transfer to El Puente Cuyabeno. Return to Quito by Public or shuttle bus.

Included:
Private Fluvial transportation El Puente - Dolphin Lodge – El Puente (by canoe)
Bilingual naturalist guide
Accommodation in double and / or triple room with mosquito nets and a private bathroom
All meals (breakfast-lunch-dinner); pure water, coffee, tea
Excursion gear (raincoat, rubber boots, camping tents, life jackets)
Excluded: Transportation Quito – El Puente - Quito (bus or plane)
Meals before and after the tour
All other expenses not specified in the tour
RecommendedPackingList: Biodegradable or natural Soap and shampoo
Bags for equipment, clothes, papers, etc.
Original Passport and / or identity card

activities: Check equipment with guide in Quito
Drive south to Machachi for lunch
Hike 45min to José Rivas Refuge at 4,800m
Have a cup of tea at 12:30am
Pack necessary things and begin summit attempt

includes: Meals (lunch and dinner on Day 1, breakfast on Day 2)

Technical mountain equipment: plastic boots, crampons, harness, carabineer, helmet, flashlight without batteries, external gloves of 2 fingers, gaiters, ice axe, windproof pants, windproof jacket, rope
not_included: Extra food and drinks, 2 liters of water per day
Personal equipment: Lycra type shirt and pants, polar jacket and pants, internal gloves, 2 to 3 pairs of socks, 2 backpacks (1 of 40 liters and 1 of 15 liters), buff
Batteries for the flashlight (2 pairs AAA)

itinerary: Salida desde la Mariscal 7:15 AM (Reina Victoria y Foch esquina, Sector PLAZA Foch) / PLAZA DE SAN BLA 7:30 AM.
Ingreso al Parque Nacional Cotopaxi 3200 m (10498.69 pies)
Explicación parte baja del Parque Nacional flora y fauna endémica.
Depende el clima fotos parte baja a 3600m (11811.02 pies). (Las personas que tienen la actividad de Caballos, su guía estará esperando por ustedes en este sector 3 horas).
Explicación sobre la caminata hasta el Refugio José Rivas 4.864m (15748.03 pies).
Explicación para las personas que tomaran la opción de descenso en bicicleta 45 m aprox.
Fotografías laguna de Limpiopungo hasta cargar las bicicletas.
Salida del Parque Nacional hasta el mismo restaurante de la mañana para el almuerzo.
Retorno a Quito (Si tiene el programa 2 días con Quilotoa transfer a la hostería Machachi)

includes.permits: Permisos para ingresar en las áreas protegidas

necessary_equipment: Ropa cómoda y de abrigo, rompevientos (opcional), guantes, protector de cuello y orejas.
Zapatos cómodos para caminar en terreno montañoso y arena.
